page.title: 11 Appleshaw.
page.content:
A vee-shaped road separates{Appleshaw from{Ragged Appleshaw. }The latter consists mainly of modern{houses}built since 1945 and a row of average-sized {bungalows. }There is a large complex of{council houses,}a{vicarage}and a couple of{cottages. }A{playing field offers a{cricket pitch}and{football facilities, both regularly used by local teams.
{Appleshaw}also has a new housing development, 'West View', but apart from this is relatively undeveloped. Another{public house,}'The Walnut Tree', a{church, post office}and food store provide the focal points. One of the inhabitants described the place as '...a real English village...' and it certainly blends in well with the general atmosphere of the block
